name: Scarf Joint
description: The scarf joint is an angled joint used to join two pieces of wood end to end. This joint is particularly useful for extending length in woodworking projects, such as creating long boards or beams from shorter pieces. When properly executed, it provides significant strength and is aesthetically pleasing when completed.
operations: Sawing the joint at the specified angle
Smoothing the joint with a hand plane
Shaping the joint edges with a pull saw
